headline: BLT Salad
description: This BLT salad with romaine lettuce, pieces of crispy bacon, tomatoes, crunchy croutons, and a creamy garlic dressing makes a great summertime dish.

video.description: Croutons, crispy bacon, and a creamy dressing, this salad has the BLT beat.
video.name: BLT Salad

name: BLT Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 head romaine lettuce - rinsed, dried and shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels; crumble and set aside
Combine mayonnaise, milk, garlic powder, and black pepper together in a blender or food processor; blend until smooth. Season with salt.
Combine lettuce, crumbled bacon, tomatoes, and croutons in a large salad bowl. Toss with dressing, and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I felt the salad needed a much higher protein content so I added one sliced hard boiled egg per person and also added two diced avocados to the bowl. The dressing was great per the recipe. I'll make this again!

I'm going to echo another reviewer who summed this reciepe up perfectly..."such humble ingredients, such an amazing salad!" The only change I made was substituting minced garlic cloves since I was out of garlic powder (weird but true). I would definitely recommend this change as I felt it gave the recipe gourmet flavor instead of what I think could have been good but everyday supper food. I used 4 garlic cloves, but you'll want to use less if you aren't a super garlic lover like me. Of course you could add a bigger variety of ingredients to the salad and that would be good too, but its perfect as it is and tastes just like an exceptional BLT sandwich. I'll definitely be making this recipe over and over again.
Too much garlic. Who puts garlic on a BLT?
Totally awesome! Everyone loved it!
We were very pleasantly surprised at how good that simple dressing tastes! We assembled the salads in two small bowls.

Made this BLT salad but I wrapped the ribs with bacon and had a dash of bbq rub, maple syrup and brown sugar. After the ribs were done and bacon were crisp we unwrapped the bacon and cut it up and put it in this salad it tastes so good
So easy, and a quick meal. Just add crusty bread, and maybe a fruit dessert. The dressing really makes it. It will be in my rotation.

We loved this. I did add avocado and cheese but it was great without them. This will become a weekly staple for us.
Delicious! Made as directed and added a sprinkle of shaved Parmesan; this salad will definitely be part of the regular rotation.
Excellent summer salad, specially if you have fresh veggies to use! It’s one way to get young ones to eat a salad.
It is very good and quite refreshing. Tastes exactly like a BLT in fact I made it 3 days in a row that's how much everyone enjoyed it.
Perfect for low-carb diet!
This is really tasty. Next time I'm going to add hard boiled eggs.

I never would have thought of making a BLT into a BLT salad. But, I'm happy that you did. I got this recipe in my email this morning and made it for my husband and me for supper tonight. May I say Yum? So easy that it will be a frequent supper this summer. Especially on those hot days when you just don't want to have to heat up the house with the oven!! 
~ J. H.
we don't love to eat vegetables in are house but my whole family loves this salad

This salad was really good, but I used Hidden Valley Ranch dressing instead. I will also not be using the lettuce in it. It was just slimy as a leftover. Also, I used a box of rotini pasta in the salad. So easy and good.

Since when is there garlic on a BLT? So glad I had more mayonnaise and milk because I made the dressing a I threw it away. used less milk and NO GARLIC. Then, for a more realistic twist, I used iceberg lettuce, added cooled caramelized onions, shredded cheddar cheese, bacon croutons and took it up a few levels.
This was fabulous! I don't know why some thought it lacked flavor. I made it exactly per the recipe and it was a huge hit with grilled sandwiches.

I have this 4/5 only because it’s not life changing. It is very easy and very good though! The only thing I did differently was use a little grated Parmesan; maybe two tablespoons; onion powder as suggested by other reviews and some co-jack shredded cheese. I didn’t add the bacon, croutons or shredded cheese until I was serving it and like other reviews suggested, I didn’t mix in all of the dressing at once because I knew there was too much for two of us to eat. I mixed what was left the next night and had it alone for dinner, though I had a little thick cut deli turkey to it. I will make this again, especially the dressing which was very good.
It was great. Next time, I might add avocados, eggs and blue cheese.
I used only 1/2 tsp garlic powder and was happy with that amount. Everyone loved this, will make this again!
Followed directions. Was very good. Great when you're not in the mood for the bread.

Family favorite!

We enjoyed it very much. We used Iceberg lettuce (because we had no Romaine) and we used about 1/2 lb of bacon. We will make it again and soon. We will try it with Romaine lettuce and probably with a full lb of bacon.

Will make again! I can only imagine adding ham, salami, pepperoni and sharp cheddar cheese to make this incredible, (and very fattening)
Easy and tasty. A good alternative to Caesar salad.
I didin't use that much bacon, because it was just for my husband and me. He had the leftovers for lunch next day.
I've made this a few times. ranks up there with taco salad. I add feta cheese to the finished product. it fits perfect

Loved it. I read lots of reviews and followed a few. Used only half the garlic powder, and substituted the other half with onion powder. Also added shredded cheese. I put the dressing on the side so it didn’t get soggy. Delicious.

My wife and I loved this salad. We will have this salad at least once a week. It also good on sandwiches.

I always follow a recipe exactly as written when I make it for the first time. That being said, this dish was absolutely delicious and everyone enjoyed the dish. This recipe was a “10” in my family. Everyone simply enjoyed this dish and a lucky few were able to get “seconds.” Which means the next time I make it I will double the ingredients. This dish will definitely be in the monthly family rotation of meals in the future.

I made this into a single portion just for myself. It was a great alternative to a higher calorie BLT! I did 2 c spring mix lettuce, 1 roma tomato, and 3 crumbled slices of bacon. For the dressing, I whisked together 1T mayo (15g), 2 T milk, 1/8t garlic powder and 1/8 t black pepper. The dressing was just enough! I thought I would share just in case there are other calorie counters out there! I estimated about 350 calories for the recipe I made.
So easy to make and it was delicious!

I took it to a dinner for 12 people and only a small part was left (I doubled the recipe) and everyone raved! I will be making this again.

2 of 3 in the family loved this
Gonna add it to the rotation
This is a very good salad and my entire family loved it, even the ones who don't like salad (including myself :-) ) 5 stars and a large thank-you for sharing the recipe!
This was awesome! I used the grease from the bacon and a loaf of Italian bread to make the croutons.
Delicious and easy! My sons high school baseball team ate it all. I used double the romaine and had plenty of dressing. No need for a pound of bacon, I used 3/4 and it was plenty.

This was so simple and so delicious! I'm trying to cut bread out but wanted a BLT tonight. I found this recipe and only tweaked three small things for personal taste. 1) I used part Greek yogurt and part vegan mayo with 1/4 c milk. 2) I used fresh minced garlic. 3) I added avocado because avocados are goodoing. It's honestly better than the Sandwich. I only did 4 stars because I changed some things ;)
Bacon salad? Yes, please! This was quick, easy, and delicious. Can't ask for much more than that!
Made a single serving of this salad and I'm glad I did because had I made more I would have eaten it all! Made this in no time at all since I had leftover bacon from this morning. Will make again.

Delicious salad with a wonderful homemade dressing. We lightly dressed the salad, and then served the remainder of the dressing off to the side for people to add more as they desired. So easy, so delicious. I really like the homemade dressing, much lighter than store-bought Ranch. I chopped the bacon before cooking it, I find it faster to cook and I am always in a hurry. Best if you eat it fresh because tomatoes always get mushy in the refrigerator.

I've made this with smoked almonds for a vegetarian and lower cholesterol version, and it's delicious.

This was easy and very tasteful! I will make this a summer favorite.

I have made this salad for so more years than I can remember. I don't add milk to the mayo since I wouldn't add it to the mayo when I make a BLT for dinner, the bread would get soggy. Depending on the size avocados I have on hand I add between 1 or 2 cut in a large dice to the salad or 1/2 to 1 whole mashed onto the bread for each sandwich. As much as we like garlic I never put garlic powder on a BLT so I don't add it to this salad. I have only home made mayo in the house made from an old recipe put out by the Wesson oil Company back in the 1930s. My Grandmother made it, my Mom made and this old man still makes it. It takes about 1/2 cup total, I think 3/4 of a cup would drown out the taste of everything else. Since I make our BLT sandwiches using a local cracked wheat sourdough I cut the same brand of sourdough into cubes and add them to the salad untoasted when I am ready to serve it. Try dicing your bacon before cooking it to whatever degree of doneness you like it, it seems to cook quicker that way. Since this is all we are going to have for dinner the whole recipe makes 2 nice satisfying servings
